Chemistry.reactions package¶

Submodules¶

Chemistry.reactions.acid_base module¶

class Chemistry.reactions.acid_base.AcidBase(acid, base, cond)¶

Bases: Chemistry.reactions.base_reactions._Reaction

Describes an acid-base reaction. Creating an instance of this object with the appropriate variables (which is handled by the application when run from the GUI) will do all the necessary prep work to perform the reaction.

Attributes

acid The compound that is being treated as an acid for this reaction.
base The compound that is being treated as an base for this reaction.
conditions The Conditions object for the reaction.

Methods

react() Performs the actual acid-base reaction.
_generate_new_keys(dict_, letter) Helper function that rebuilds the dictionary so keys are sequential and start at one.
acid¶

The compound that is being treated as an acid for this reaction. Note that if the conditions are acidic the compound being passed in as the acid may not be the one used in the reaction (if the conditions are more acidic than the compound that purports to be an acid).

base¶

The compound that is being treated as an base for this reaction. Note that if the conditions are basic the compound being passed in as the base may not be the one used in the reaction (if the conditions are more basic than the compound that purports to be an base)

conditions¶

The Conditions object for the reaction. Should contain enough information for the reaction to take place. Not including important information about solvents, other present molecules and the like will impair the results. Can be given a dictionary instead of a Conditions object - it will be transformed into a Conditions object

react()¶

Performs the actual acid-base reaction. Current implementation is incomplete and only accurately describes a small fraction of acid-base reactions

Chemistry.reactions.base_reactions module¶

class Chemistry.reactions.base_reactions.Conditions(conditions)¶

Bases: object

Object that represents the conditions in which a reaction occurs. Contains information like relative acidity/basicity of the conditions, as well as anything else that is pertinent to the reaction

Attributes

neutral The neutrality of the Conditions.
pka_molecule  
acidic = False¶
basic = False¶
neutral¶

The neutrality of the Conditions. A read-only property in order to minimize the danger of creating conditions that are False for each of acidity, basicity, and neutrality. That would be bad and cause a number of problems.

pka = 16¶
pka_location = ''¶
pka_molecule = None¶
class Chemistry.reactions.base_reactions._Reaction¶

Bases: object

The abstract base _Reaction object. I treat a reaction as a first class citizen (like functions).

Methods

react() The specific mechanics of how any given reaction progresses
_generate_new_keys(dict_, letter) Helper function that rebuilds the dictionary so keys are sequential and start at one.
react()¶

The specific mechanics of how any given reaction progresses

static _generate_new_keys(dict_, letter)¶

Helper function that rebuilds the dictionary so keys are sequential and start at one. Returns a dictionary that can be used as reference for the new keys

For example,

>>> _Reaction._generate_new_keys({'a2': 1, 'a3': 2}, 'a')
{'a3': 'a2', 'a2': 'a1'}

Module contents¶

This is the reactions package of the simulator app. It contains all of the necessary code to describe reaction objects and their processes.
